page.title: 16Pets
page.content: Nearly all the children in our class have pets. Here are some. I have a grey and white rabbit called Charlie. We thought at first it was a buck but now we know it is a doe so we ought to change its name. She eats dandelions and carrots. I have two cats, a tom called Ginger and a she called Tiddles. They are both ginger and white. They sleep with their heads under their paws. My dog is called Spike. He is a sandy haired mongrel and is two years old. His favourite food is spaghetti. Spike is a very good swimmer. Flash is the name of my pet budgie. She is grey with red cheeks and spotted wings. She talks, sometimes saying "Who's a pretty boy?" and "Hello!" She is three years old. Dogs and cats are the most common pets but several children have fish.
